dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs in swampy parts of quiet brooks under forest cover (Ref. 3788).  Not a seasonal killifish.  Is very difficult to maintain in aquarium (Ref. 27139).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.title: Range Description
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Moelants, T. 2010. Aphyosemion abacinum. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: A Lower Guinea endemic, found in northeastern Gabon between the Djoua and Djadie (or Zadie) River systems, Ivindo basin. The species may be found in the Minkebe National Park to the northwest of its known range, but this area is very difficult to sample.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Africa:  Endemic to the area north of Mékambo, upper Ivindo drainage, northeastern Gabon.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Environment
dataObjects.description: benthopelagic; non-migratory; freshwater; pH range: 6.0 - 7.0; dH range: 10

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Conservation
dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Moelants, T. 2010. Aphyosemion abacinum. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
VU
Vulnerable

Red List Criteria
B1ab(iii); D2

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Moelants, T.

Reviewer/s
Bennett, L., Snoeks, J. & Allen, D.

Contributor/s

Justification
The species has a narrow range (extent of occurrence (EOO) is estimated at around 12,000 km²) and based on its threats from iron mining, commercial logging, and slash and burn agriculture, it is found in fewer than five locations. The species may be found in the Minkebe National Park to the northwest of its known range, but this area is very difficult to sample. If the species were to be found in this area, the species' EOO would still not exceed 20,000 km².
